_metadata.description: Google Gem definition template focused strictly on System Instructions (4 Pillars).
_metadata.instructions: Fill out the gem_instructions object. Compile the 4 pillars into a single text block and save as 'copy_paste_instructions.txt'.
_metadata.usage: Use this JSON to define behavior. The final output must be a plain text file ('copy_paste_instructions.txt') for pasting into the Gem interface.

gem_details.description: Short description of what this Gem does.

gem_instructions._description: The core behavior definition. These 4 sections must be compiled into the Gem's 'Instructions' text field.

persona.description: Tell your Gem what role to play and how to respond.
persona.role: e.g., Coding Partner, Creative Writer, Tutor
persona.tone: e.g., Patient, Enthusiastic, Professional, Sarcastic. Consider including pedagogical stances like 'Encourage first attempts'.

task.description: Tell the Gem what you want it to do or create.

context.background_info: e.g., User level, project context, specific constraints
context.interaction_style: e.g., Ask clarifying questions before answering

format.description: Be specific about the desired output structure and conversational workflow.
interaction_chain: Step 1: Understand request (e.g., Ask clarifying questions)

validation._description: Test cases to verify the instructions produce the desired behavior.

test_cases.expected_behavior: Description of how the Gem should respond based on Persona/Task/Context/Format

changes: Removed knowledge_base and triggers to focus strictly on System Instructions
